business.headline: Sensex ends 678 points higher, Nifty above 24,900; Tata Motors falls 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 677.75 points to close at 81,796.15, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 227.90 points to end at 24,946.50.

Omaxe shares jump 14% on launch of New Amritsar township projectThe surge in Omaxe's share price can be attributed to the company's announcement of a new integrated township project named New Amritsar.

Air India plane crash: Will it have a negative impact on the aviation industry?The crash brought Boeing's safety record back under the scanner. Experts added that this could trigger deeper global regulatory scrutiny of Boeing's production and maintenance standards.
Are Bajaj Finance shares really down 90% today?Bajaj Finance shares have not crashed. What investors are seeing is a temporary adjustment due to a stock split and bonus issue.
Think you're exempt from filing ITR? Your lifestyle may say otherwiseIt is no longer just about how much you earn. If your lifestyle tells a different story, the taxman is likely paying attention.

Who is Arun Srinivas, new India head of Meta?Arun Srinivas joined Meta (formerly Facebook) in September 2020. Arun Srinivas started his career in the fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) space, joining Reebok in 1996.

We trapped ourselves: Data scientist's post on middle class spending sparks debateIs the middle class a victim of the system or just bad at managing money? A Mumbai-based data scientist sparks debate with a provocative take.

Sensex rises 600 points despite Israel-Iran tensions. What's fuelling the rally?On Monday morning, both benchmark indices opened firm despite geopolitical concerns, with the BSE Sensex rising 170.94 points to 81,289.54 and the NSE Nifty50 gaining 62.90 points to trade at 24,781.50 as of 10:19 am.

Foxconn ships 97% of India-made iPhones to US to dodge Trump's China tariffsThe numbers show that Apple has shifted its export focus from a mix of countries to mainly serving the U.S. market. Earlier, Indian exports were sent to places like the Netherlands, the Czech Republic, and the UK.

Tata Motors shares sink over 5% today. What's behind the sharp decline?The decline was primarily driven by a downward revision in Jaguar Land Rover's (JLR) earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT) margin forecast for the fiscal year 2026.

Gold price rises amid Israel-Iran tensions: Should you buy now or wait?Gold prices are rising again as global tensions heat up and markets turn cautious. With rates inching higher, should you be buying gold or waiting it out?
Sensex, Nifty open higher as IT stocks rally amid Israel-Iran conflictThe S&P BSE Sensex was up by 257.49 points to 81,376.09, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 83.20 points to 24,803.55 as of 9:29 am.

DLF set to invest Rs 5,500 crore to build luxury housing project in GurugramDLF has seen significant sales momentum in Gurugram, where its previous projects have sold out rapidly. Privana South, launched in January 2024, saw all 1,113 apartments sold in just three days, generating Rs 7,200 crore.

Stock market opening today: Will Sensex, Nifty crash again on June 16?Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) have maintained their selling stance for a third consecutive session, resulting in net outflows of Rs 54,020 crore in June alone. Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) have continued their buying spree.

Stocks to watch on June 16: Adani Enterprises, Sun Pharma, NTPC, Bajaj FinanceAs trading resumes on Monday, shares of several companies will be in focus due to fresh developments. These include Adani Enterprises, Sun Pharma, NTPC, Bajaj Finance, Vedanta, and others.

Advance tax alert: First instalment due by June 15, find out if you are liableAdvance tax simply means paying your income tax in parts throughout the year, instead of waiting till the end. If your total tax due for the year is more than Rs 10,000, then you must pay it in advance in four instalments.
Iran-Israel tensions rise. Why India should worryThe escalating Iran-Israel conflict poses significant challenges for India, particularly concerning oil imports and economic stability.

Sensex settles 573 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; Adani Ports falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 573.38 points to end at 81,118.60, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 169.60 points to close at 24,718.60.

Gold prices rise sharply amid Israel-Iran tensions in IndiaThe rise in gold prices is being linked to worries over a possible wider conflict in the Middle East, which has made investors turn to gold as a safe place to park money.

Oswal Pumps opens Rs 1,387 crore IPO with strong brokerage backingOswal Pumps targets Rs 1,387.34 crore from IPO. Experts recommend subscribing due to strong fundamentals. IPO open until June 17, 2025.

Air India crash rattles hotel and ticketing stocks, as investor confidence waversOnline travel companies were among the most affected. Shares of Thomas Cook India fell by 2.39%, trading at Rs 160.03 as of June 13, 1PM. TBO Tek dropped 1.10% to Rs 1,287.40, while Mahindra Holidays slipped 1.47% to Rs 342.35.

Air India crash: How airline insurance works and why premiums may riseIncidents like the recent Air India crash can result in a total loss, meaning the aircraft is beyond repair with no salvageable parts. In such cases, the losses can reach around $130 million, roughly $80 million for the plane and $30-50 million in liabilities.

Who are the likely insurers for Air India plane crash?The plane involved in the crash was a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, one of the most modern aircraft used in commercial aviation. It was carrying 242 people, including 12 crew members.

Boeing's revival on trial after deadly Air India Dreamliner crash in AhmedabadThe fatal crash of Air India flight AI-171, a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, minutes after takeoff from Ahmedabad, has killed 241 people on board, reigniting serious doubts over Boeing's aircraft safety and corporate oversight.

Oil shock hits Dalal Street: BPCL, ONGC, IOC, other crude-sensitive stocks fallBrent crude oil futures jumped more than 9% to touch around $75.61 per barrel, reaching a multi-month high. The gain came after Israel said it had launched what it called "preemptive strikes" against Iran.

RBI steps in to contain fallout of oil price jump on rupee: ReportThe Indian rupee dropped to 86.20 against the US dollar in early trade but later recovered to 86.04, helped by the central bank's likely intervention.

Aviation stocks tumble after Air India plane crash in AhmedabadSpiceJet's share price dropped 3.42% at the start of the trading session. InterGlobe Aviation Ltd, the company that runs IndiGo, also fell 4.83%, slipping to Rs 5,212 in early trade.
Sensex, Nifty crash as Israel attacks Iran; oil prices jump sharplyThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 838.78 points to 80,853.20, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 252.80 points to 24,635.40 as of 9:25 am.

Sensex falls over 1,100 points. Why is the stock market falling today?The BSE Sensex was down 1121.35 points to 80,570.63 at 9:16 am, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 334.65 points to trade at 24,553.55.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty crash today over Israel-Iran conflict?The situation in the Middle East has affected global investor sentiment. Oil prices also jumped on fears that the strikes could affect supply from the region, which is known for producing large amounts of oil.

Stocks to watch on June 13: Tata Group, RIL, HCL, Asian Paints, ICRA, ICICI BankShares of several Tata Group companies, such as Tata Motors, Tata Steel and Tata Chemicals, are expected to remain in the spotlight after the crash of Air India flight AI171 in Ahmedabad shortly after takeoff.

Boeing shares slide 5% after Air India Dreamliner crash kills over 200Flight AI171, bound for London, went down minutes after departure, killing more than 200 people in what is now the world's deadliest aviation disaster in a decade. The cause of the crash remains unclear.

Tata Group to give Rs 1 crore to families of Ahmedabad Air India crash victimsTata Group will offer Rs 1 crore to family members of people who lost their lives in the Ahmedabad crash of Air India Flight 171, which killed over 200 people on Thursday.

This is a difficult day for us: Air India CEO reacts to Ahmedabad plane crashAt least 204 people were killed and 41 injured after the London-bound Air India flight crashed just minutes after taking off from Ahmedabad's Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport on Thursday.

Retail inflation hits six-year low, falls to 2.82% in May 2025The decline in retail inflation is mainly because food prices rose at a much slower pace than before. Cheaper vegetables, fruits, cereals, and pulses helped bring food inflation down sharply. In May, food inflation fell to 0.99% from 1.78% in April.

Sensex tanks 823 points, Nifty falls below 25,000; Tata Motors falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 823.16 points to close at 81,691.98, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 253.20 points to settle at 24,888.20.

Boeing reacts to Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad, says aware of initial reportsThe London-bound flight AI-171, carrying 242 people including 230 passengers and 12 crew members, crashed in the Meghaninagar area near the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport minutes after takeoff. The plane had issued a mayday call before losing contact with air traffic control.

Shocked and deeply saddened: Gautam Adani after Air India plane crash in AhmedabadOn Thursday afternoon, an Air India flight heading to London crashed just minutes after take-off, with 242 people on board. The flight, AI-171, was being operated by a Boeing 787 Dreamliner.

Focus on supporting affected people: Tata Group chief on Ahmedabad plane crashThe airplane crash has led to a temporary suspension of flight operations at Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport.

Boeing shares tumble 8% after Air India flight crashes in AhmedabadBoeing shares nosedived over 8% in pre-market trade after the Air India Dreamliner crash in Ahmedabad, deepening investor concerns over the jetmaker's safety record and regulatory troubles.

entertainment.headline: Govinda's wife Sunita visits Kal Bhairav temple in Ujjain on her 57th birthdayGovinda's wife, Sunita Ahuja, celebrated her 57th birthday by offering prayers at Kal Bhairav temple in Ujjain, Madhya Pradhesh. In the video circulated on the social media Sunita can be seen sitting inside the temple premises.

Encouraged, humbled, grateful: Vishnu Manchu on Rajinikanth's reaction to KannappaTamil superstar Rajinikanth was all praise for Vishnu Manchu's 'Kannappa'. The latter shared an emotional post on X, recalling Thalaivar's reaction after watching the film.

Actor Sagarika Ghatge reveals son's face in emotional Father's Day postActor Sagarika Ghatge pens a long note for her husband, cricketer Zaheer Khan, on social media to celebrate Father's Day. The actor reveals her son Fatehsinh Khan's face in the post. The couple welcomed their son in April this year.

First Copy trailer: Munawar Faruqui plays piracy kingpin in nostalgic seriesThe trailer of Munawar Faruqui-starrer 'First Copy' released on Monday. In the series, the stand-up-comedian-turned-actor plays the role of a piracy kingpin. 'First Copy' will stream on OTT from June 20.

Raveena Tandon boards Air India flight days after crash, shares moving noteActor Raveena Tandon shared her emotional experience on an Air India flight that she boarded days after the tragic plane crash in Ahmedabad. She praised the strength and silent resilience of the crew and passengers.

Kamal Haasan congratulates Abhishek Banerjee for Stolen, meets film's teamActor Abhishek Banerjee is receiving widespread praise for his powerful role in the thriller 'Stolen', which recently earned a special accolade from the legendary Kamal Haasan during a meeting in Chennai. The film premiered on Prime Video on June 4.

Rashmika blushes when asked about Vijay Deverakonda in viral videoActor Rashmika Mandanna was seen blushing when anchor Suma Kanakala said Vijay Deverakonda's name at the pre-release event of her upcoming film, 'Kuberaa'. The video is now going viral on social media.

Adnan Sami catches up with old pals, meets Jackson Wang at Hrithik Roshan's homeSinger Adnan Sami recently met K-pop star Jackson Wang at a dinner hosted by actor Hrithik Roshan. The singer also met old friends, singer Salim Merchant and music composer Pritam. Jackson Wang is currently in India for the promotion of his latest album, 'MAGIC MAN 2'.

Special Ops 2 trailer: Kay Kay Menon and team to fight cyber terrorism this timeThe trailer of Kay Kay Menon-starrer 'Special Ops 2' finally released on Monday. In the latest season, Kay Kay Menon as Himmat Singh will be seen leading the fight against cyberterrorismc and artificial intelligence.

Big B's gratitude note for fans who visit him outside Jalsa despite heavy rainAmitabh Bachchan expressed gratitude to his fans who gathered outside his residence, Jalsa, braving heavy rain just to catch a glimpse of him. The veteran actor shared emotional words and photos on his blog, humbly stating that he bows down to their unwavering love.

Is BLACKPINK planning a comeback? Jisoo hints at 'something amazing'The K-pop girl band member Jisoo revealed in a recent interview that BLACKPINK is planning a comeback with the 'DEADLINE' tour. After a three-year hiatus, they are back with their first group album.

Prabhas's Raja Saab makers say they shot for 16-18 hours amid 8-hour shift debateAt the teaser launch of Prabhas's 'The Raja Saab', the makers revealed their gruelling 16 to 18-hour workdays to deliver the film's high-quality output. The film will release in theatres on December 5.

Preity Zinta's twins hold hands on Father's Day family stroll picActor Preity Zinta shared a Father's Day post on social media, featuring her husband Gene Goodenough and their kids Jai and Gia.  The photo featured her kids holding hands as they took stroll in a picturesque location.

Samantha, Naga Chaitanya's Ye Maaya Chesave to re-release in theatres in JulySamantha and Naga Chaitanya's 'Ye Maaya Chesave' is set to re-release in theatres next month. The film marks its 15th anniversary this year.

Soundarya Sharma on changing landscape in Bollywood: Old stereotypes are fadingSoundarya Sharma expressed her gratitude for a role in 'Housefull 5' and reflected on the changing landscape for female actors in Bollywood. She emphasised the importance of versatility in her career.

Pooja Hegde wraps Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan, his last filmPooja Hegde has officially wrapped up the shooting schedule for Thalapathy Vijay's upcoming film 'Jana Nayagan'. She shared a picture of herself announcing the same.

Did Kiara share baby shower pic with Sidharth on Father's Day? Fans ask for moreActor Kiara Advani's Father's Day post is making all the buzz for a particular photo with Sidharth Malhotra. The photo appears to be from Kiara's baby shower.

Did Kriti Sanon just confirm joining Don 3? Her viral reaction hints soIt looked like actor Kriti Sanon seemingly confirmed her entry into 'Don 3' following Kiara Advani's exit from the project. A video of Sanon blushing as paps called her 'Lady Don' is going viral.
Justin Bieber publicly ends friendship after being called out for angerJustin Bieber's friend voiced frustration after the singer lashed out at him.

general news.headline: Stunning video shows miracle Air India crash survivor emerging from infernoA new video of last week's Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad, which killed 270 people, shows the miracle survivor, Viswashkumar Ramesh, emerging from the crash site.

Anti-terror body condemns Pahalgam attack: Couldn't have occurred without moneyStrongly condemning the Pahalgam terror attack, the FATF highlighted Pakistan's terror financing routes and said that such attacks could not have happened without the movement of money.

Weapon used to kill Raja Raghuvanshi in Meghalaya honeymoon murder recoveredA machete used in the murder of Indore-based Raja Raghuvanshi, who died while honeymooning in Meghalaya, has been found from the crime spot. Raja's wife, Sonam, her lover and three accused are currently in police custody.

Don't want to continue: Audio of Air India Dreamliner that returned to Hong KongThe Air India flight AI 315 returned to Hong Kong after nearly 90 minutes of take-off after a technical glitch was reportedly detected in the aircraft.

Why MAGA isn't going gaga about Trump backing IsraelIsrael's attack on Iran, and the US's involvement in the conflict, has seemingly created a rift within the Republican camp, pitting the party's age-old support for Israel and hostility toward Iran against the MAGA base's growing fear of being dragged into another foreign war.

New CCTV clip shows woman attacking Rapido driver detained for slapping herCCTV footage accessed exclusively by India Today shows that the woman, who was hit by a Rapido bike rider in Bengaluru, hit him first after what looks like an argument.

Message for Turkey? Why Modi's first post-Op Sindoor trip is to CyprusPrime Minister Modi's first post-Operation Sindoor visit to Cyprus could be a strategic message amid deepening Turkey-Pakistan ties. After the April 22 terror attack, Cyprus backed India and vowed to raise the issue of cross-border terrorism at the EU level, highlighting a growing alignment which now extends to trade, energy, and EU cooperation.

Mumbai roads waterlogged as heavy rain pounds city, orange alert issuedContinuous rainfall has been reported across Mumbai and its suburbs for the past two hours. However, no major waterlogging has been reported so far in the city and local train services are also running on time.

RAT, Mayday, CVR: Breaking down aviation terms you've heard since Air India crashSince the fatal June 12 crash of Air India Flight 171, terms like RAT, CVR, and Mayday have filled coverage of the air crash. The Boeing 787 Dreamliner went down seconds after take-off, a rare and catastrophic failure. As investigators pore over flight data and debris, here's a quick explainer to make sense of the aviation jargon everywhere.

Once allies, now archrivals: The fallout between Iran and IsraelIsrael's first open offensive on Iran marks a dramatic turn in a long, complex history. Before Iran's 1979 revolution, the two were close allies, trading arms, oil, and intelligence. The Shah saw Israel as a key partner against Arab rivals. But the Islamic Republic's rise, proxy wars, and nuclear ambitions turned friendship into enmity.
Donald Trump might launch his own phone and telecom networkDonald Trump could be planning his next big move — and this time, it's not politics or real estate.

Two India-bound Dreamliners, two mid-air scares within hours, both turn backJust days after a fatal Dreamliner crash in Ahmedabad, two India-bound Boeing 787-8 flights were forced to turn back to Hong Kong and London mid-air, respectively, due to some suspected technical glitches.

Longevity unlocked: Can we really reverse our biological age?The global anti-ageing market is rapidly expanding with a growing demand for personalised and scientific approaches. India is gradually shifting focus from visible ageing signs to deeper biological health for longevity.

Iran planning to leave nuclear treaty, paving way for atomic weaponsIran may exit the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT) as its parliament prepares a bill, while Tehran reiterates opposition to nuclear weapons and upholds its right to peaceful nuclear energy.

Centre announces dates for population census, to be held in two phasesThe announcement of Census 2027 clears the path for the Women's Reservation Bill and the controversial delimitation exercise, which had been frozen since 1971 through various constitutional amendments.

Pak assured tit-for-tat if Israel used N-bomb on us, Iran says; Islamabad denies"Pakistan has told us that if Israel uses a nuclear bomb on Iran, then Pakistan will also attack Israel with a nuclear bomb," General Mohsen Rezaei, an IRGC commander and member of Iran's National Security Council, said on Iranian state television.

Bali, Thailand, Vietnam, now Philippines: Is Southeast Asia India's new backyard?Visa relaxations make a destination more attractive for hassle-free travel. With the Philippines now visa-free for Indians, can we expect an influx of Indian tourists to the country?

US expert Steve Scheibner revises Air India crash theory, cites engine failurePointing to a video of the Air India flight -- shot from a nearby rooftop --  that captured the moments leading up to the crash, Scheibner said there was sufficient audio and visual evidence to indicate that the ram air turbine (RAT) was deployed shortly after takeoff.
No rings, no roles, no rules: The freedom of Relationship AnarchyInstead of assuming roles, Relationship Anarchy invites you to co-create relationships that fit the needs of the partners.

Not an era of war, PM Modi reiterates in Cyprus amid Israel-Iran conflictPrime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday reiterated his 'not an era of war' message in Cyprus amid the ongoing Israel-Iran conflict.

Video: Woman pulls out gun on UP petrol pump attendant after heated argumentA video from Uttar Pradesh's Hardoi district went viral showing a girl pointing a revolver at a petrol pump salesman during a dispute over refuelling. Police registered a case, detained the girl and her father, and seized the weapon.

Filmmaker missing after Air India crash, wife's agonising search continuesAccording to Mahesh Kalawadia's wife, the police informed her that his phone was located 700 meters from the crash site and went off a minute before the flight took off.

Karnataka bike taxi ban comes into effect, operators plead 'It's how we survive'The Namma Bike Taxi Association has urged Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Rahul Gandhi to stop Karnataka's ban on bike taxis that came into effect today. The group argues the ban threatens livelihoods and affordable daily commutes for millions.

Live: US embassy in Tel Aviv suffers damage after Iranian strike, shut for todayIsrael Iran Conflict Live Updates: Israel continued its military strikes on Iran for a third straight day, targeting Tehran and other regions, killing 224 people, including Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) intelligence chief Mohammed Kazemi and two generals. Israel's airspace and airports were shut down. Army chief Eyal Zamir vowed to intensify the attacks against what he called an "existential threat".

sports.headline: R Ashwin accused of ball-tampering with chemically-treated towels in TNPL: ReportTNPL 2025: R Ashwin and his team, the Dindigul Dragons, have been accused of using towels to alter the condition of the ball during their match against the Madurai Panthers on Saturday in Salem. The Madurai franchise has submitted a formal complaint to the league organisers, alleging ball tampering by Dindigul.

England would want repayment of investment from Archer: BroadFormer cricketer Stuart Broad says Jofra Archer must repay England's faith with his fitness and performance. Archer's readiness for Test cricket remains uncertain ahead of the India series, raising concerns about his ability to handle red-ball demands.

Gautam Gambhir's mother stable, coach to rejoin squad in England on June 17: ReportGautam Gambhir will rejoin the Indian cricket team in Leeds on June 17 ahead of the first Test against England. Gambhir had flown home after his mother suffered a heart attack.

India vs Pakistan on October 5, venues, dates and full list of matchesThe ICC Women's ODI Cricket World Cup 2025 will kick off on September 30, with co-hosts India and Sri Lanka facing off in the opening match at M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru. Here are the venues, dates, and the full list of matches.

Matthew Hayden reveals how India can tame England in upcoming Test seriesFormer Australia cricketer Matthew Hayden has revealed how India can win the upcoming series against England, set to begin from June 20 at Headingley, Leeds.

Shohei Ohtani: An Athlete who earns more from endorsements than Ronaldo, MessiKnown globally for his rare dual-threat ability as both a dominant pitcher and a powerful hitter, Japanese baseball star Shohei Ohtani earns more from endorsements than Cristiano Ronaldo, Lionel Messi, LeBron James, and Tyson Fury.

Washington Sundar has been my inspiration since I was young: Sai SudharsanSai Sudharsan, recently named in India's red-ball squad for the five-match Test series against England, has shared that fellow Chennai cricketer Washington Sundar has been an inspiration to him since he was a child.

Siraj must aim to become frontline bowler for India: Former bowling coachFormer India bowling coach Bharat Arun has advised Mohammed Siraj to become India's frontline bowler in the upcoming Test series against England.

An Indian cricketer told me to retire: Karun Nair reveals ahead of Test comebackKarun Nair has revealed that about two years ago, a 'prominent Indian cricketer' advised him to consider retiring and focus on securing his future through overseas T20 leagues-something only possible if he severed ties with the BCCI, as per board rules.

ENG vs IND: Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy launch delayed due to Ahmedabad air tragedyThe launch of the Anderson-Tendulkar trophy has been delayed due to the Ahmedabad plane crash tragedy. England and India will now play for the Anderso Tendulkar trophy in England instead of Pataudi Trophy.

India vs Pakistan women's ODI World Cup set for October 5 in Colombo: ReportThe women's ODI World Cup will reportedly kick off on 30 September, with India taking on Sri Lanka at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.

Washington Sundar has been my inspiration since I was young: Sai SudharsanSai Sudharsan, recently named in India's red-ball squad for the five-match Test series against England, has shared that fellow Chennai cricketer Washington Sundar has been an inspiration to him since he was a child.

Siraj must aim to become frontline bowler for India: Former bowling coachFormer India bowling coach Bharat Arun has advised Mohammed Siraj to become India's frontline bowler in the upcoming Test series against England.

An Indian cricketer told me to retire: Karun Nair reveals ahead of Test comebackKarun Nair has revealed that about two years ago, a 'prominent Indian cricketer' advised him to consider retiring and focus on securing his future through overseas T20 leagues-something only possible if he severed ties with the BCCI, as per board rules.

ENG vs IND: Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy launch delayed due to Ahmedabad air tragedyThe launch of the Anderson-Tendulkar trophy has been delayed due to the Ahmedabad plane crash tragedy. England and India will now play for the Anderso Tendulkar trophy in England instead of Pataudi Trophy.

India vs Pakistan women's ODI World Cup set for October 5 in Colombo: ReportThe women's ODI World Cup will reportedly kick off on 30 September, with India taking on Sri Lanka at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.

Jaiswal on cusp of history, eyes Dravid and Sehwag's major record in EnglandStar India batter Yashasvi Jaiswal is on the cusp of history as he has a golden chance to become the fastest Indian player to complete 2000 runs in Test cricket.

England to beat India 3-2: Dale Steyn makes bold prediction ahead of Test seriesFormer South African fast-bowling great Dale Steyn has predicted that each match in the upcoming five-Test series will be closely contested, yet produce a definitive result. Steyn believes England will beat India to clinch the series 3-2.

Who's taken Rohit Sharma's seat on the team bus? Kuldeep Yadav revealsStar India spinner Kuldeep Yadav has revealed who's taken Rohit Sharma's place on the Indian team bus. Rohit Sharma recently announced his retirement from Tests ahead of the series against England.

India's intra-squad match called off after Shardul hits 122 vs Bumrah, SirajShardul Thakur made a case for his inclusion in India's playing XI for the first Test against England after starring with both bat and ball in India A's intra-squad match. His performance intensifies the race for the all-rounder spot ahead of the England Test series.

Mitchell Johnson questions Josh Hazlewood for prioritising IPL after WTC final lossFormer Australia fast bowler Mitchell Johnson has questioned Josh Hazlewood for prioritising the Indian Premier League (IPL) ahead of national commitments after loss in the WTC final.

PSG thrash Atletico Madrid, Bayern Munich demolish Auckland CityParis Saint-Germain crushed Atletico Madrid 4-0 in their march toward global domination at the FIFA Club World Cup on Sunday, while Bayern Munich showed no mercy to Auckland's amateurs, delivering a ruthless 10-0 thrashing.

Pole vaulter Mondo Duplantis breaks world record for 12th time, first time at homePaul Vaulter Mondo Duplantis broke the world record for a whopping 12th time in his career at the Wanda Diamond League meeting in Stockholm. The 25-year-old was thrilled to have achieved the feat for the first time on home soil at the historic 1912 Olympic Stadium.

Canadian Grand Prix: George Russell wins from pole as Piastri and Norris collideGeorge Russell handed Mercedes its first win of the Formula One season with a composed drive at the Canadian Grand Prix on Sunday. The race also saw a major shift in the championship standings, as McLaren's Oscar Piastri moved 22 points clear at the top after teammate Lando Norris collided with him and was forced to retire.

Mitchell Johnson questions Josh Hazlewood for prioritising IPL after WTC final lossFormer Australia fast bowler Mitchell Johnson has questioned Josh Hazlewood for prioritising the Indian Premier League (IPL) ahead of national commitments after loss in the WTC final.

PSG thrash Atletico Madrid, Bayern Munich demolish Auckland CityParis Saint-Germain crushed Atletico Madrid 4-0 in their march toward global domination at the FIFA Club World Cup on Sunday, while Bayern Munich showed no mercy to Auckland's amateurs, delivering a ruthless 10-0 thrashing.

Pole vaulter Mondo Duplantis breaks world record for 12th time, first time at homePaul Vaulter Mondo Duplantis broke the world record for a whopping 12th time in his career at the Wanda Diamond League meeting in Stockholm. The 25-year-old was thrilled to have achieved the feat for the first time on home soil at the historic 1912 Olympic Stadium.

Canadian Grand Prix: George Russell wins from pole as Piastri and Norris collideGeorge Russell handed Mercedes its first win of the Formula One season with a composed drive at the Canadian Grand Prix on Sunday. The race also saw a major shift in the championship standings, as McLaren's Oscar Piastri moved 22 points clear at the top after teammate Lando Norris collided with him and was forced to retire.

Lewis, Hosein annihilate Ireland in 3rd T20I, set up 1-0 series win for WIWest Indies beat Ireland by 62 runs in the third T20I and won the series by 1-0 after the first two matches were washed out due to rain. Evin Lewis was adjudged Player of the Match for his innings of 91 (44).

Rugby Premier League: Bengaluru-Delhi split points in opening dayThe inaugural season of the Rugby Premier League kicked off with exciting matches and a grand opening ceremony. The event brought together top players, celebrities, and dignitaries, signalling a new era for rugby in India.

Gennaro Gattuso replaces Luciano Spalletti as Italy national team coachGennaro Gattuso has been appointed head coach of the Italy national football team. His leadership comes at a crucial time as Italy aims to qualify for the 2026 FIFA World Cup.

No Nicholas Pooran, no problem: West Indies slam 256 runs in T20I vs IrelandEvin Lewis and Shai Hope's brilliant partnership helped West Indies reach 256 against Ireland the 3rd T20I of their series. Windies would hope to move on from Nicholas Pooran, who recently called time on his international career.

AUS remain at the top of ICC Test rankings despite WTC loss to SADespite losing the World Test Championship final to South Africa, Australia maintained their lead in the latest update of the ICC Test team rankings with the Proteas jumping up to second in the charts.

Virat Kohli pens father's day note, reveals moment that changed his lifeVirat Kohli shared an emotional note remembering his late dad on Father's Day. He highlighted how his father's refusal of shortcuts shaped his approach to hard work and success.

Shubman Gill's positivity is rubbing off on Indian team: Kuldeep YadavShubman Gill is set to captain India for the first time in Test cricket. Kuldeep Yadav revealed that his positivity is keeping the team upbeat ahead of the 5-match series.

Rohit's apprentice prepared and ready for leadership role: Kuldeep YadavEngland vs India: Spinner Kuldeep Yadav has said that Shubman Gill is more than ready to take over the Indian team. Yadav has said that Shubman has been around Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli for year and a half and has gained a lot of knowledge.

Why Virat Kohli did not speak to AB de Villiers for months? Legend revealsAB de Villiers revealed Virat Kohli stopped speaking to him after he leaked the news about Anushka being pregnant with the latter's second child.

Johnson urges selectors to look beyond Starc, Lyon after WTC lossMitchell Johnson has urged the Australian selectors to explore their options beyond the star-studded bowling attack which has the likes of Pat Cummins, Mitchell Starc, Josh Hazlewood and Nathan Lyon. This comes after Australia were beaten by South Africa in the WTC final.

Laxman to lead India's preparations for 1st Test in Gambhir's absence: ReportVVS Laxman will reportedly be leading India's preparations for the England series in Gautam Gambhir's absence. The head coach is expected to rejoin the side ahead of the first Test in Headingley.

South Africa wins first World Test Championship title with Bavuma's heroic inningsSouth Africa cricket team sang an incredible tribute to their captain, Temba Bavuma, after the WTC Final win against Australia. The moment became viral on the internet.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
